hanzi-su-wiki:
驚

Значения

Изумляться, пугаться

Мнемоника

Лошадь 馬 пуглива и требует почтительного 敬 обращения.

Варианты

惊
purpleculture_pinyin:
jīng
to startle; to be frightened; to be scared; alarm
испугать; испугаться; быть испуганным; тревога
rtega_mnemonic:
驚驚RS
惊惊		wonder, be surprised, frightened, amazed
  • hand instilling respect into children 敬 for the frightening power of a wonderful horse 馬
  • ⓢ heart 忄in a big capital 京: full of wonder and surprise, sometimes frightened
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 惊)
Pictophonetic: 敬 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
驚訝 [ jīng yà ]: amazed; astonished; to surprise; amazing; astonishment; awe
驚人 [ jīng rén ]: astonishing
驚喜 [ jīng xǐ ]: nice surprise; to be pleasantly surprised
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 敬 [ jìng ] to respect, to honor; respectfully
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: You are startled, standing in front of the 8th wonder of the world, a huge trojan horse. All you can do is revere it.
heisig_constituent: wonder, awe, flowers, phrase, bound up, mouth, taskmaster, team of horses
koohiiStory1: You stand in AWE at the 8th WONDER of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.
koohiiStory2: This is another word for surprise. 驚く＝おどろく= surprise. The Trojans stood in awe of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their surprise (wonder) when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed: It´s a wonder that the Trojans managed to speak keigo 敬語 even then, saying "わたくしたちを殺さないでください!!お願い致します!!").
jp_example_words:
驚き(おどろき): surprise, astonishment, wonder
驚異(きょうい): wonder, miracle
吃驚(びっくり): be surprised, be amazed, be frightened, astonishment
驚かす(おどろかす): surprise, frighten, create a stir
驚く(おどろく): to surprise
jp_readingExamples: 驚かす (おどろ.かす), 驚く (おどろ.く)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you can write an interesting poem about winter while riding on a horse, I’ll be pretty surprised. It’s hard enough to write a poem as it is, let alone an interesting one. And then you’re riding on a horse and the poem has to be about winter? Heck, I’d be surprised if you didn’t fall off the horse and injure yourself.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine trying to write a poem while riding a horse. It’d be really hard to do. I bet you’d be surprised if you managed to do it as well.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You might also be surprised to learn that you are to ride this horse all across きょうと. That gives you a time limit. You have until you traverse きょうと to write this poem about winter.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine riding through きょうと on a horse. As if that wasn’t difficult enough for poem writing, now you have all the sights and sounds of きょうと to distract you as well.
Ru_Radicals: 勹 (обёртка), 口 (рот), 夂 (зима), 艾 (мокса), 攵 (складной стул), 馬 (лошадь)
Ru_trainchinese: jīng: (глаг) быть потрясенным, пугаться; (о лошади) шарахнуться, понести
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if you respect (敬) the horse (馬) he'd be surprised
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When seeing the huge buildings in the capitol for the first time your state of mind is completely startled.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " horse ", " respect ", the original meaning is that the horse acts abnormally due to sudden stimulation. "Shuowen": "Ma Haiye. From the horse, respectful." "Zuo Zhuan‧ Xianggong 28th Year": "The Qing family's Ma Shan is shocked."

" Scare " can mean panic and fear. "Zhuangzi·Dasheng": "For example, if you carry horses and wagons with horses and horses, you can use bells and drums for music. How can you be so evil?" Cheng Xuanyingshu: "How can there be no fear."

" Surprise " also means surprise and surprise. "Zhuangzi·Dasheng": "Zi Qing cuts the wood to turn it into 鐻, 鐻成, when you see it, you will be shocked by ghosts and gods."

" Surprised " also means quickness. "Han Fei-Zi·Fore Chu Shu Said Upper Left": "The guardian has a survivor, and the bird arrives. Because the bird is frightened first, the bird will not shoot."

" Surprise " also refers to chaotic appearance. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Shenda": "Don't dare to speak frankly, your life is shocking." Gao You's note: "Scare, chaotic appearance."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " horse " and " respect ", the original meaning is that the horse is acting abnormally due to sudden stimulation.
humanum_full_description:
從「馬」，「敬」聲，本義為馬受突然的刺激而行動失常。《說文》：「馬駭也。从馬，敬聲。」《左傳‧襄公二十八年》：「慶氏之馬善驚。」

　　「驚」可表示驚慌、恐懼。《莊子‧達生》：「譬之若載鼷以車馬，樂鴳以鐘鼓也。彼又惡能無驚乎哉？」成玄英疏：「何能無驚懼者也。」

　　「驚」也表示驚訝、驚奇。《莊子‧達生》：「梓慶削木為鐻，鐻成，見者驚猶鬼神。」

　　「驚」還表示迅疾。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「衛人有佐弋者，鳥至，因先以其裷麾之，鳥驚而不射也。」

　　「驚」也指紛亂貌。《呂氏春秋‧慎大》：「莫敢直言，其生若驚。」高誘注：「驚，亂貌。」
humanum_short_description: 從「馬」，「敬」聲，本義為馬受突然的刺激而行動失常。

  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 敬 [ jìng ] to respect, to honor; respectfully

①騾馬等因爲害怕而狂奔起來不受控制：驚車。驚羣。馬驚車敗。
②害怕，精神受了突然刺激而緊張不安：驚恐。驚駭。驚愕。驚惶。驚詫。驚遽。驚厥。驚悟。驚心動魄。驚惶失措。驚世駭俗(言行出奇，使世人驚恐)。
③震動：驚動。驚擾。驚堂木。打草驚蛇。
④出人意料的：驚喜。

從「 馬 」，「 敬 」聲，本義為馬受突然的刺激而行動失常。《說文》：「馬駭也。从馬，敬聲。」《左傳‧襄公二十八年》：「慶氏之馬善驚。」 「 驚 」可表示驚慌、恐懼。《莊子‧達生》：「譬之若載鼷以車馬，樂鴳以鐘鼓也。彼又惡能無驚乎哉？」成玄英疏：「何能無驚懼者也。」 「 驚 」也表示驚訝、驚奇。《莊子‧達生》：「梓慶削木為鐻，鐻成，見者驚猶鬼神。」 「 驚 」還表示迅疾。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「衛人有佐弋者，鳥至，因先以其裷麾之，鳥驚而不射也。」 「 驚 」也指紛亂貌。《呂氏春秋‧慎大》：「莫敢直言，其生若驚。」高誘注：「驚，亂貌。」
From the sound of " horse", " respect", the original meaning is that the horse acts abnormally due to sudden stimulation. "Shuowen": "Ma Haiye. From the horse, respectful." "Zuo Zhuan‧ Xianggong 28th Year": "The Qing family's Ma Shan is shocked." " Scare" can mean panic and fear. "Zhuangzi·Dasheng": "For example, if you carry horses and wagons with horses and horses, you can use bells and drums for music. How can you be so evil?" Cheng Xuanyingshu: "How can there be no fear." " Surprise" also means surprise and surprise. "Zhuangzi·Dasheng": "Zi Qing cuts the wood to turn it into 鐻, 鐻成, when you see it, you will be shocked by ghosts and gods." " Surprised" also means quickness. "Han Fei-Zi·Fore Chu Shu Said Upper Left": "The guardian has a survivor, and the bird arrives. Because the bird is frightened first, the bird will not shoot." " Surprise" also refers to chaotic appearance. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Shenda": "Don't dare to speak frankly, your life is shocking." Gao You's note: "Scare, chaotic appearance."

驚字的基本解释

驚
jīng
见“惊”。

驚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jīng］
［《廣韻》舉卿切，平庚，見。］
“惊1”的繁体字。
(1)马受突然的刺激而行动失常。
(2)惊慌；恐惧。
(3)使惊惶恐惧；震惊。
(4)惊讶；惊奇。
(5)迅疾。
(6)纷乱貌。
(7)迅猛涌出。
(8)病名。即小儿惊风症。
(9)通“警”。警戒。

驚字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　驚； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1446第04
【唐韻】【集韻】舉卿切【正韻】居卿切，?音京。【說文】馬駭也。【玉篇】駭也。【易·震卦】震驚百里。【詩·大雅】震驚徐方。【老子·道德經】得之若寵，失之若辱，是謂寵辱若驚。　又叶居陽切，音姜。【張籍·祭韓愈詩】月中登高灘，星漢交垂芒。釣車擲長綫，有獲齊驩驚。

暂无。

[①]［jīng］
["Guangyun" Ju Qingqie, Ping Geng, see. ]
The traditional characters of "闘1".
(1) Horses act abnormally due to sudden stimulation.
(2) Panic; Fear.
(3) To panic and fear; shock.
(4) Surprised; surprised.
(5) Swiftness.
(6) Chaotic appearance.
(7) Gushing violently.
(8) The name of the disease. That is, convulsions in children.
(9) Through the "Policy". alert.

[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] Ju Qing cut [Zheng Yun] Ju Qing cut,? Yin Jing. [Said the text] Ma Haiye. [Jade articles] Shock also. [Yi·Zhen Gua] Shocked Baili. [Poetry Daya] Shocked Xu Fang. [Laozi·Tao De Jing] If you get favored, if you lose it, you are disgraced.　Ye Juyang cut again, sound ginger. [Zhang Ji · Poems to Worship Han Yu] Ascend the high beach in the middle of the moon, and the stars and the Han people cross together. The fishing trolley threw a long line, and Qi Huan was shocked.

shock
Name meaning

jīng
вм. 惊
Radicals: 苟, 夂, 馬  (poem, winter, horse)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you can write an interesting poem about winter while riding on a horse, I’ll be pretty surprised. It’s hard enough to write a poem as it is, let alone an interesting one. And then you’re riding on a horse and the poem has to be about winter? Heck, I’d be surprised if you didn’t fall off the horse and injure yourself.
Imagine trying to write a poem while riding a horse. It’d be really hard to do. I bet you’d be surprised if you managed to do it as well.
Reading Mnemonic
You might also be surprised to learn that you are to ride this horse all across きょうと. That gives you a time limit. You have until you traverse きょうと to write this poem about winter.
Imagine riding through きょうと on a horse. As if that wasn’t difficult enough for poem writing, now you have all the sights and sounds of きょうと to distract you as well.
